initialnote: A local outbreak in Beijing has led to the closure of schools in many districts.     https://archive.vn/MREU2

Japan has been critisezed for not testing as well as their counterparts. However, its testing policy was revised to target most symptomatic individuals.  This might contribute to their testing policy.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/backstories/1082/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200625085357/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/06/02/national/science-health/japan-saliva-pcr-virus-test/

Although Japan was previously criticized for inefficient testing, its testing policy was revised to accommodate more tests.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/backstories/1082/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200625085357/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/06/02/national/science-health/japan-saliva-pcr-virus-test/

Several new tax reliefs announced on May 28th to be implemented from June, including:  - Enterprises operating registered hotels, guesthouses, restaurants and travel agency companies in Phnom Penh city, Siem Reap, Sihanouk, Kep and Kampot provinces, and Bavet and Poi Pet cities, shall be further exempted from payment of all kinds of monthly taxes for the taxable months of June and July 2020.  - Airline companies registered in Cambodia and still operating, shall receive a further exemption of  Minimum Tax (MT) for the two months of June and July 2020.   - Reduction of the Withholding Tax from loans  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200627011140/https://home.kpmg/content/dam/kpmg/kh/pdf/technical-update/2020/tu-further-government-tax-reliefs-tax-update-kpmg-cambodia.pdf
The Cultural Affairs Bureau will resume operation of its performance venues from 26 June (Friday) onwards.  Link: https://news.gov.mo/detail/en/N20FVolMk4?0

Philippine officials have placed a central city back under strict lockdown and retained quarantine restrictions in the capital for another two weeks as coronavirus infections continue to spike alarmingly.    President Rodrigo Duterte approved in a televised meeting Monday night with key Cabinet officials a recommendation to lock down Cebu city anew and retain quarantine restrictions in metropolitan Manila where many of the nearly 26,500 infections and more than 1,000 deaths have been recorded.  Link: https://abcnews.go.com/Health/wireStory/latest-india-train-carriages-virus-beds-71250586

From June 19,Â Singapore has entered Phase Two of its COVID19 policy, and most sectors are now open with special safety measures in place, including dine-in restaurants and retail outlets. Businesses are still required to offer the option for remote work by default, wherever possible. Businesses that fail to comply with the necessary safety measures may be obliged to close.     https://archive.vn/qVq8N
Phase Two of Singapore's Circuit Breaker policy, which began on June 19, does not include any recommendations to close public transport.    https://archive.vn/qVq8N
People are encouraged to work from home wherever possible, and social distancing measures must be complied with, but there are no curfews or requirements in place.    https://archive.vn/qVq8N

On June 15, the cabinet revoked the decision on half-pay for non-essential public servants that started on March 31.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200625095853/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
From June 15, schools with less than 120 students are allowed to reopen, as Thailand's lockdown is gradually becoming more relaxed.     https://archive.vn/LbdBO

June 2 - From June 2 to 26, the land ported will only be open on Tuesday from 10 am to 12 pm. The priority of entry should be given to Timorese nationals and traded goods. On June 18 it was ruled that drivers of trucks transporting traded goods must change at the border.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200625065149/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRGABMI1Jun2020pt.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200625065220/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GABMI18Jun2020pt.pdf    No policy change. The state of emergency is set to last until June 26.    The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures are clarified in a decree approved on April 29, stating that entry into the national territory is forbidden to foreign nationals. The prohibition does not apply to foreign nationals who were born in Timor-Leste territory and who usually reside here or who are the legal representatives of Timorese minors or third-country nationals who are legal residents of Timor-Leste over whom they exercise parental authority or ensure their support and education. The prohibition provided does not apply to foreign nationals who carry out their professional activity on oil platforms located in the Timor Sea.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606075632/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/EE2-sai-husi-umaa2.pd

Tests ongoing on suspect cases (in the link illegal immigrants from Vietnam were tested). Until June 15, about 1830 tests have been conducted.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200625071246/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/06/15/covid-19-rezultadu-ezame-laboratoriu-ba-sidadaun-estanjeiru-nain-13-negativu/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200625071720/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/06/15/durante-loron-52-la-deteta-kazu-foun-covid-19/

Rent tax cancelled for all tenants and landlords for the year 2020:  "Part of the Governments economic and fiscal stimulus package in response to the Covid-19 Virus is to cancel rent tax in respect of the 2020 year.  This means that there is no requirement to file rent tax returns or make payments of rent tax in the 2020 year.  The rent tax returns and payments usually due on 29th June 2020 and 28th December 2020 are not required."    https://vanuatucustoms.gov.vu/images/public_notice/2020/Public_Notice_no003_2020.pdf
